titleproper.value:
Guide to Dale F. Oliver ephemera collection
                    <num>2012.010</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Stephanie Coy

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2015-05-28T11:32-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The collection consists of 20th century ephemera belonging to Dale F. Oliver. Included is a railway token for the C.R. & L. Lines, a dog tag for Dale Oliver, a service pin, a Brooklyn Vocational School pin, a metal dog license, Brooklyn, 1941 issued by the A.S.P.C.A., a complaint letter from a neighbor to Dale F. Oliver, a Brooklyn Technical High School diploma for Dale Oliver, a Brooklyn Technical High School yearbook from 1933 called "The Blue Print", and an autograph book for Bedford School, PS 3 from 1929.

p.value: Identification of item, date (if known); Dale F. Oliver ephemera collection, 2012.010, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Gift of Jeanne Oliver Harris and Elizabeth Dale Oliver, 2012.

Overall the collection documents the student life of a second generation immigrant in Brooklyn, New York, during the 1920s and 1930s. The collection does not include any materials that provide greater insight into Dale Oliverâ€™s life outside of his education and the information provided by the pins and token.

subject.value: Professional education |z New York (State) |z Kings County
